intro: Planchonella pohlmaniana, commonly known as the Pohnpei satinash, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the island of Pohnpei in the Caroline Islands of Micronesia. The plant is a small evergreen tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptical in shape, with a glossy dark green upper surface. The flowers are small, clustered in panicles, and are followed by yellowish-orange fruits that are edible when ripe.
